revision:
Median of Grouped Data

    Formula:

    1. Find cumulative frequency.
    2. The class whose cumulative frequency is greater than (and nearest to) \(n\over 2\)⋅ This is called the median class.
    3. Median = l +\({{({n\over 2} - cf})\over {f}}\)*h

      4. Where,

        l = lower limit of the median class,

        h = size of the class interval (assuming all class sizes to be equal),

        f = frequency of the median class,

        cf = cumulative frequency of the class preceding the median class,

        n = numbers of observation.

    4. Also, 3 median = mode + 2 mean
